doc.title: Great Wall Motor (H/A)
doc.source_uri: 2025-09-02/Great Wall Motor HA 2Q25 in-line Strong new models likely improving profitability raise EPS and POGreat Wall Motor HA 2Q_2025-09-02

passages.text: PO:19.00 HKD | Price:18.59 HKD

GWM's 2Q25 earnings was RMB4.6bn, up \(19\%\) YoY, in- line with prelim result. We lift our 2025/26/27E earnings by \(19\% /15\% /14\%\) to reflect (1) strong model cycles to boost volume sales - we raise 2025/26/27E volume by \(4\% /3\% /6\%\) . (2) rising Tank/WEY momentum and recovering overseas sales to support profitability - we keep GPM/OPM estimates largely unchanged; and (3) ICEV models potentially stabilizing in 2026- 27. We lift PO to HKD19.0 (was HKD14.6)/RMB27.4 (was RMB21.1) for GWM- H/GWM- A, mainly as we raise EPS/FCF forecasts and lift target P/E from 8x to 10x (see details inside). We change our income rating from 8 (same/lower) to 7 (same/higher).

We expect GWM's strong model cycles to boost volume sales. GWM plans to launch a few new/facelift models in 2H25, including facelifted Tank 400/700, Gaoshan 7, and facelifted Menglong, which are expected to support volume sales growth of 40- 50% HoH in 2H25. GWM's monthly sales is expected to reach 130k units in Sep and 150k units in 4Q25, supported by increasing contribution of new models in the domestic and overseas markets. In addition, WEY and Ora brands will each release a new platform and launch 1- 2 new models on each platform in 4Q25. Management guides for at least 15 new/facelift models to be launched in 2026. Despite the rich model pipeline in 2H25, we reiterate Neutral on GWM- H, as we see strong model pipeline and moderate earnings growth is fairly valued (10x 2026E P/E, 1 S.D above 3- year average). We reiterate Underperform on GWM- A, given its stretched valuation (17x our 2026E P/E).

We believe rising Tank/WEY momentum and recovering overseas sales to support profitability. For instance, new Tank 500 received 12k orders in 2 hours after launch on 27 Aug; WEY Gaoshan 7 is scheduled to launch on 10 Sept. GWM's overseas sales were up \(8\%\) YoY/ \(3\%\) MoM to 41k units in July, recovering from downtrend in 1H25, helped by diversifying country exposure besides Russia. Mgmt. guides monthly export sales to reach 40- 45k units in 3Q25, and 500k units in 2025. Lastly, we expect its ICEV models to benefit from supportive policies amid the anti- involution environment in 2026.
\\* For full definition of Qmethod\\* measures, see page 10.

GWM has a strong model line- up, and it plans to launch facelifted TanQ00/700, Gaoshan 7, and facelifted Menglong in 2H25. GWM's monthly sales is expected to reach 130k units in Sep and 150k units in 4Q25, supported increasing contribution of new models in the domestic and overseas markets. In addition, WEY and Ora brands will each release a new platform and launch 1- 2 new models on each platform in 4Q25. With sales ramp- up of new models, GWM expects its monthly volume sales to rise from 110k units in June to 130k units in late- 3Q25/early- 4Q25 and further to 150k units by end- 4Q25. In summary, GWM expects volume sales to grow \(40 - 50\%\) HoH in 2H25.

We expect to see some supportive policies in ICEV amid the anti- involution environment in 2026, since ICEV companies are still key contributors in employment/tax in China. We forecast HAVAL ICEV models will see stable (flat YoY or mild decline) volume sales in 2026, partially on higher EV purchase tax and a likely lower EV purchase subsidy.

GWM's overseas sales were up \(8\%\) YoY/3% MoM to 41k units in July. Breakdown by country: Russia 12k units (around \(30\%\) ), Brazil 3.5k units (robust MoM growth from \(2k+\) units), Mexico \(1k+\) units, Latin America 8.0k units, Australia 5k units, the Middle East 4k units, Central Asia 3k units, Southeast Asia 2k units, South Africa 2k units, and North Africa 2k units.

GWM expects sales volume in Southeast Asia to continue to improve MoM helped by Tank 300/500 diesel fuel version launch. Management guides monthly export sales to reach 40- 45k units in 3Q25, hitting historical new high, and targets export sales volume of 500k units in 2025. In addition, GWM started production of its first factory in Brazil in August, and it is scoping out sites for a second plant as it ramps up its ambitions in South America's largest economy. According to management, Brazil plant localization production saves per vehicle cost by RMB5k- 9k compared with imported models. In terms of margins for exported models, Tank and pick- up brand post similar margin with domestic models, while Haval brand's margin in overseas market is 5ppt higher than domestic market.

Great Wall Motor (GMW) announced 2Q25 results on 29 August: revenue was RMB52.3bn, up 8% YoY/31% QoQ. Gross margin was 18.8%, down 1.7ppt YoY but up 1.0ppt QoQ. OPM came in at 3.3%, down 3.1ppt YoY/but up 2.4ppt QoQ. 2Q25 net income was RMB4.6bn, up 19% YoY/162% QoQ. Net income adjusted for non-recurring items was RMB2.1bn, down 42% YoY/up 44% QoQ. The RMB2.5bn non-recurring items in 2Q25 were mainly due to Russia scrappage tax refund (including RMB900mn deferred from 1Q25 to 2Q25). GWM recorded sales volume of 313k units in 2Q25, up 10%YoY/22% QoQ.
Exhibit 1: P&L summary (quarterly)
2Q25 net income was RMB4.6bn, up 19% YoY/162% QoQ
Source: Company report
Factoring in 2Q25 result, 7M25 volume sales and latest model pipeline, we raise our 2025/26/27E volume by 3.5%/3.4%/6.3% and raise 2025/26/27E revenue by
7.3%/8.2%/10%. We maintain GPM and OPM estimates largely unchanged. Net-net, we lift our 2025/26/27E earnings by 19%/15%/14%.
Exhibit 2: New vs. old estimates
We raise 2025/26/27E earnings by 19%/15%/14%
Source: BofA Global Research estimates
BofA GLOBAL RESEARCH
Valuation - GWM-HOur new PO of HKD19 (was HKD14.6) for GWM-H is derived from an average of P/E and discounted cash flow (DCF) methodologies.
Exhibit 3: Valuation summary Our new PO is HKD19.0 for GWM-H
Valuation methodologyImplied value (HKD)Upside/downside potentialParametersMethodology 1DCF19.8WACC of 10.8%Methodology 2P/E multiple18.210xPrice Objective (rounded)19.03%
Source:BofA Global Research estimates

DCF methodology: A fair value of HKD19.8 (was HKD16.7) is derived from our DCF calculation, with assumptions of \(1\%\) FCF perpetuity growth and \(10.8\%\) (was \(10.6\%\) based on the latest capital structure) weighted- average cost of capital (WACC).

P/E methodology: We derive our P/E- based valuation of HKD18.2 (was HKD12.5) by applying a target P/E of 10x (was 8x) to GWM- H's 2H25- 1H26E EPS. Our target multiple of 10x is one standard deviation above GWM- H's past- 3- year historical average, mainly as we turn more positive on the company outlook, given strong model cycles to boost volume sales, rising Tank/WEY brand momentum to lift and stabilizing overseas sales to support profitability. Earlier, we applied a target P/E of 8x (past- 3- year historical mean).
Exhibit 4:GWM-H's historical P/E trading average GWM currently is trading at 10x
Source:Bloomberg,BofA Global Research estimates
Exhibit 5:GWM-H's historical 1-year forward P/E band GWM is currently trading above its historical average
Source:Bloomberg,BofA Global Research estimates

Valuation - GWM- AOur new PO of RMB27.4 (was RMB21.1) for GWM- A is derived from applying \(60\%\) A/H premium (unchanged, average A/H premium since the initial public offering) to our GWM- H implied value.
Exhibit 6: Global auto OEM valuation comparison table GWM-H's closest peer, BYD-H share/Geely, is trading at 17x/11x 2026 PER
Source: BofA Global Research estimates, Bloomberg, \\*estimates from Bloomberg consensus, \\*we use adjusted EPS excluding one-off items
Our PO of HK\\$19.0 for GWM- H is derived from an average of P/E and discounted cash flow (DCF) methodologies.
DCF methodology: A fair value of HK\\$19.8 is derived from our DCF calculation, with an assumption of \(1\%\) FCF perpetuity growth and \(10.8\%\) weighted- average cost of capital (WACC).

P/E methodology: We derive our P/E- based valuation of HK\\$18.2 by applying a target P/E of 10x (one standard deviation above past- 3- year historical average) to GWM- H's 2H25- 1H26E EPS, mainly as we turn more positive on the company outlook, given strong model cycles to boost volume sales, rising Tank/WEY brand momentum to lift and stabilizing overseas sales to support profitability.
Upside risks: Success of WEY launch and stronger- than- expected margin recovery Downside risks: Weak macro, competition, Haval brand aging
Our PO of RMB27.4 for GWM- A is derived from applying \(60\%\) A/H premium (average A/H premium since IPO) on our GWM- H implied value.
Our PO of HK\\$19.0 for GWM- H is derived from an average of P/E and discounted cash flow (DCF) methodologies.
DCF methodology: A fair value of HK\\$19.8 is derived from our DCF calculation, with an assumption of \(1\%\) FCF perpetuity growth and \(10.8\%\) weighted- average cost of capital (WACC).

P/E methodology: We derive our P/E- based valuation of HK\\$18.2 by applying a target P/E of 10x (one standard deviation above past- 3- year historical average) to GWM- H's 2H25- 1H26E EPS, mainly as we turn more positive on the company outlook, given strong model cycles to boost volume sales, rising Tank/WEY brand momentum to lift and stabilizing overseas sales to support profitability.
Upside risks: Success of WEY launch and stronger- than- expected margin recovery. Downside risks: Weak macro, competition, Haval brand aging.

Qmethodis the set of BofA Global Research standard measures that serve to maintain global consistency under three broad headings: Business Performance, Quality of Earnings, and validations. The key features of
Qmethod are: A consistently structured, detailed, and transparent methodology. Guidelines to maximize the effectiveness of the comparative valuation process, and to identify some common pitfalls.

Qabotase is our real-time global research database that is sourced directly from our equity analysts' earnings models and includes forecasted as well as historical data for income statements, balance sheets, and cash flow statements for companies covered by BofA Global Research.
Qprofile, Qmethod" are service marks of Bank of America Corporation. Qabotase is a registered service mark of Bank of America Corporation.

FUNDAMENTAL EQUITY OPINION KEY: Opinions include a Volatility Risk Rating, an Investment Rating and an Income Rating. VOLATILITY RISK RATINGS, indicators of potential price fluctuation, are: A - Low, B - Medium and C - High. INVESTMENT RATINGS reflect the analyst's assessment of both a stock's absolute total return potential as well as its attractiveness for investment relative to other stocks within its Coverage Cluster (defined below). Our investment ratings are: 1 - Buy stocks are expected to have a total return of at least \(10\%\) and are the most attractive stocks in the coverage cluster; 2 - Neutral stocks are expected to remain flat or increase in value and are less attractive than Buy rated stocks and 3 - Underperform stocks are the least attractive stocks in a coverage cluster. An investment rating of 6 (No Rating) indicates that a stock is no longer trading on the basis of fundamentals. Analysts assign investment ratings considering, among other things, the 0- 12 month total return expectation for a stock and the firm's guidelines for ratings dispersions (shown in the table below). The current price objective for a stock should be referenced to better understand the total return expectation at any given time. The price objective reflects the analyst's view of the potential price appreciation (depreciation).
Investment ratingTotal return expectation (within 12-month period of date of initial rating)Ratings dispersion guidelines for coverage clusterR2Buy≥ 10%≤ 70%Neutral≥ 0%≤ 30%UnderperformN/A≥ 20%
R2Ratings dispersions may vary from time to time where BofA Global Research believes it better reflects the investment prospects of stocks in a Coverage Cluster.

INCOME RATINGS, indicators of potential cash dividends, are: 7 - same/higher (dividend considered to be secure), 8 - same/lower (dividend not considered to be secure) and 9 - pays no cash dividend. Coverage Cluster is comprised of stocks covered by a single analyst or two or more analysts sharing a common industry, sector, region or other classification(s). A stock's coverage cluster is included in the most recent BofA Global Research report referencing the stock.
